data.title: Gallery Visit: Magic Realism: Art in Weimar Germany 1919-33
data.meta_description: I visited the Tate Modern this weekend and viewed the public exhibition Magic Realism. data.text: I visited the Tate Modern this weekend and viewed the public exhibition Magic Realism. I was able to explore the German art and diverse practices of a number of different artists. The term ‘magic realism’ was coined by the art historian Franz Roh in the early 1920s to describe a shift from the art of the expressionist era, towards cold veracity and unsettling imagery. In the context of growing political extremism, the new realism reflected a fluid social experience as well as inner worlds of emotion and magic.
